TopicTitle: Make the small gear bay more useful

Articles.Content:
As you may have noticed, landing legs can bend the feet to match the ground, so they don't rest on a little tip.

Something which, unfortunatly, doesn't happen with landing gears, leading to situations where you veer off-course, crash, and those poor kerbals die (R.I.P. Jebbie;.. Anyway, since 0.25 is getting closer and closer, maybe this is something to think about. An example of the landing gear, being on an angle is the F-18 Hornet, as seen here.

It would be nice if you could adjust the height of the gears, too. (so it doesn't look like it has those tiny, T-Rex paws as landing gears)

Thanks for reading, please leave your opinion below.

Edited September 23, 2014 by iphone_max

Yep landing gears need some love. Adapting the hight is the biggest issue to me, because of tailstrikes etc. Also i dont like it as a physicsless part. Considering the size of a small plane it's strange that such a "big" part is not represented in it's mass

Height is indeed a big issue, cause if you were to make an exact replica of an F18 for instance, its more like a belly slider than a real fighterjet, ofcourse you can use girders, but that just looks awful :/
